meanings.definition: A condition in which an abnormal accumulation of cerebrospinal fluid in the brain causes enlargement of the skull and compression of the brain.
meanings.sent1: The doctors diagnosed the baby with hydrocephaluses.
meanings.sent2: The hospital had a special unit for babies with hydrocephaluses.
meanings.sent3: The baby with hydrocephaluses had a big head, like a little alien.
meanings.sent4: Her worries weighed on her mind like hydrocephaluses, pressing down relentlessly.
meanings.sent5: The image of the swollen brain stuck in her mind, a haunting reminder of hydrocephaluses.

meanings.sent1: The medical report mentioned several cases of hydrocephaluses.
meanings.sent2: The researchers studied different types of hydrocephaluses.
meanings.sent3: In the museum, they displayed models of various hydrocephaluses.
meanings.sent4: The classroom was filled with questions about hydrocephaluses, buzzing like bees.
meanings.sent5: The textbooks illustrated the concept of hydrocephaluses with colorful diagrams.
